On Thu, 30 Mar 2023 15:29:59 -0400, Sarena Tuttle emailed Juanita Downs:

Case: Juanita-Nicole-Downs-MVA-4-16-2021
Client: Juanita Nicole Downs
__Re: Settlement__
CC:
Good afternoon Juanita,
 Thank you for reaching out. Your claim is in litigation which is a
lengthy process averaging 18-24 months without any extensions or delays. At
this time your claim is in the Discovery Phase which is the longest of
phases. During this phase the attorney's exchange official documents that
require certification from their sources as well as other information
related to the accident, injuries & treatment.
 Once we move out of the written discovery phase, we will enter an
oral discovery phase at which time, we will look to schedule depositions of
the defendants and any experts needed for your claim. If the Defense
Attorney would like to take your oral statement, we will reach out to you
about scheduling.
 Please understand that there are a lot of things that take place on
your behalf without your direct participation. In the meantime, we are
working on your behalf and will reach out once we move into the oral
discovery phase of your claim. However, if you have any questions, please
feel free to contact us to discuss them in further detail.
Sarena M. Tuttle
Litigation Paralegal &
Workers' Compensation Case Manager
The Whaley Law Firm

__Re: Process of settlement__
CC:
Good morning Juanita,
 I'm a bit confused. I'm not sure who told you your case was settled.
When you & I spoke on August 24, 2023, I advised that we are still
attempting to take the Deposition of the owner of the vehicle. At that
time, we had filed a Motion to Compel the Deposition and the Defendant was
ordered to appear for a deposition within 30 days.
 The Defendant has not appeared or been produced for the deposition to
date. Bryce, an attorney with our office, has followed up on the order and
filed a Motion for Sanctions and Default Judgement earlier this week.
Sanctions are penalties for not following a court order and a Default
Judgement is an order ruling in your favor. We are currently awaiting the
Judge's approval or objection to those motions.
 If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact
us directly to discuss this in more detail.

Client: Juanita Nicole Downs

Good morning Juanita,
 Thank you for reaching out. Currently your claim is scheduled for Motion Hour on December 9, 2024 to compel Defendant Turner's Responses to the Discovery Requests sent to him. Unfortunately, there has been a significant delay due to Defendant Turner's criminal history and having been recently re-arrested. Once we receive his Discovery Responses, we will reach out to you & Destiny with a more detailed updated. If you have any other questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly at (502) 583-4022 Ext 104 or Bryce at Ext 114. -Sarena, The Whaley Law Firm

 Type the witness first or last name and click the SEARCH tool or hit ENTER.
 4. All related transcript files will then appear on the screen to the
 right.
Thank you!!
